Responses.NAM1 - Response Text: There is a legend about "Stone Fire Men" who brought the light of justice to the land.
Though the Bal Molagmer were thieves, they stole only from the unjust and gave to those in need.
They vanished early in the Third Era, and have not been seen since. I believe it is time for the Bal Molagmer to return. Here--
These gloves were used by the Bal Molagmer to carry their burning stones from the Red Mountain.
When you are ready to rekindle the fires of the Bal Molagmer, wear the gloves and speak with me again.
I wish you could have carried out the work of the Bal Molagmer, but you've been expelled.
If you make amends, perhaps you can do the work of the Bal Molagmer again.
The Bal Molagmer once carried burning stones from Red Mountain throughout Morrowind, lighting hearth fires and spreading the light of justice.
There is a rumor that you murdered Vala Catraso. I do not know if it is true, but I cannot let you pretend to be a Bal Molagmer with these rumors.
Unfortunately, you are known to have killed Salyn Sarethi. No Dunmer would follow one such as you.
I will have to find someone else to carry on the work of the Bal Molagmer.
The Bal Molagmer, or "Stone Fire Men," once carried their burning stones from Red Mountain over all of Morrowind, lighting hearth fires and lanterns.
Are those Bal Molagmer gloves? Those are priceless historical treasures.
The Bal Molagmer, or "Stone Fire Men," once carried their burning stones from Red Mountain over all of Morrowind, lighting hearth fires and lanterns.
Are those Bal Molagmer gloves? Those are priceless historical treasures.
Unfortunately, you are known to have killed Salyn Sarethi. No Dunmer would follow one such as you.
I will have to find someone else to carry on the work of the Bal Molagmer.
Don't you have your gloves? It's important you have them.
If you don't wear the gloves of the Bal Molagmer, how can you show these Dunmer that thieves are not wholly evil?
If you don't wear the gloves of the Bal Molagmer, how can you show these Dunmer that thieves are not wholly evil?
I don't know what else the Bal Molagmer should do.
Now you know as well as I do what the Bal Molagmer should do. I will trust your judgement.
Now you know as well as I do what the Bal Molagmer should do. I will trust your judgement.
The Ordinators have been harassing Danso Indules, an honest but poor priest. I want you to steal a Dwemer goblet and donate it to her cause.
Everyone in Caldera is corrupt. Rather than act directly, I want you to steal Odral Helvi's history books.
Everyone in Caldera is corrupt. Rather than act directly, I want you to steal Odral Helvi's history books.
Unlike most Dunmer, the Bal Molagmer opposed slavery. I want you to steal Brallion's ring.
One of our brothers stole from the wrong man. I need someone to return the blade Enamor.
One of our brothers stole from the wrong man. I need someone to return the blade Enamor.
A poor widow needs our help. A Hlaalu Councilor is trying to steal her land with a forged land deed.
You did well with the Hlervu Locket. For the next appearance of the Bal Molagmer, I want proof of Yngling Half-Troll's corruption.
Find proof of Yngling Half-Troll's corruption.
I've chosen something simple for the first mission of the reformed Bal Molagmer. I need you to return the Hlervu Locket.
The Bal Molagmer, or "Stone Fire Men," once carried their burning stones from Red Mountain over all of Morrowind, lighting hearth fires and lanterns.
It is said that their fires brought the light of justice. They vanished many years ago.
